alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 25 at 1:33PM PST until December 28 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 12 inches, except 8 to 24 inches above 7000 feet. Wind gusts near 50 mph possible with gusts up to 100 mph along the Sierra ridgetops. Waves 3 to 5 feet on Lake Tahoe. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. Small vessels could capsize on Lake Tahoe. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy rain will move into the area late Monday night. Snow will be possible above 7000-7500 feet overnight with initial accumulations of 3 to 11 inches through Tuesday morning above 7500 feet. Impacts will be limited to these higher elevations during this time.
info.instruction: Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the storm arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of time.
